nominalpy.nominalpy.sensitivity.analysis module

[ NOMINAL SYSTEMS ]

This code is developed by Nominal Systems to aid with communication to the public API. All code is under the the license provided along with the ‘nominalpy’ module. Copyright Nominal Systems, 2023.

class nominalpy.nominalpy.sensitivity.analysis.SensitivityAnalysis(credentials: Credentials, config: SensitivityConfiguration)

Bases: Entity

The Sensitivity Analysis class is able to create multiple simulations with varying parameters and allow the data to be extracted from at the end of the simulation. Each simulation will be identical with the exception of some user defined parameters within the configuration.

add_case(case: SensitivityCase) → None

Attempts to add a new sensitivity case to the sensitivity analysis system.

Parameters:

case (SensitivityCase) – The new sensitivity case that should be analysed

cases: list = []
config: SensitivityConfiguration = None
get_values(object: str, message: str, parameter: str, min_time: float = 0.0, max_time: float = 0.0) → list

Returns all of the values from particular messages stored in the database based on the name of the message. If the message does not exist, then this will return an empty list. This also fetches data within the minimum and maximum time (if applicable). This requires a valid parameter name to search for.

Parameters:

  • object (str) – The name of the object that should be searched for in the analysis

  • message (str) – The name of the message that should be searched for in the object

  • parameter (str) – The name of the parameter within the message that should be read

  • min_time (float) – The minimum time in simulation seconds that should be returned as a value

  • max_time (float) – The maximum time in simulation seconds that should be returned as a value

Returns:

A list of JSON values associated with the data within the subscription, if it exists

Return type:

list

ids: list = []
message_ids: list = []
new_case() → SensitivityCase

Creates a new sensitivity case and added into the sensitivity analysis list to be edited.

Returns:

A new sensitivity case that has been added

Return type:

SensitivityCase

run(time: float, step: float = 0.1) → None

This will run the simulation based on the configuration and the parameters. This will have a fixed step size and will run each simulation for the desired time in seconds.

Parameters:

  • time (float) – The simulation time that the analysis should be run for in seconds

  • step (float) – The time-step in simulation seconds that the simulation should be ticked

subscribe(object: str, message: str, interval: float = 10.0)

Registers a new message to be subscribed to in the database system based on the object name and the message name, if it exists.

Parameters:

  • object (str) – The name of the object that should be searched for in the analysis

  • message (str) – The name of the message that should be subscribed to in the object

  • interval (float) – The time interval that data should be captured at in simulation seconds

subscriptions: list = []

nominalpy.nominalpy.sensitivity.case module

[ NOMINAL SYSTEMS ]

class nominalpy.nominalpy.sensitivity.case.SensitivityCase

Bases: object

The Sensitivity Case class enables the user to define a particular case with a series of parameters that will be adjusted in this ID. These will be the parameters compared to the initial case in the simulation configuration.

add(object: str, param: str, value: str)

Adds a new entry into the data, including the object to modify, the parameter to change and the new value in a valid JSOn format.

Parameters:

  • object (str) – The name of the object that should be modified

  • param (str) – The name of the parameter within the object that should be modified

  • value (str) – The new value of the parameter that should be updated in the analysis

Returns:

The current instance of the sensitivity case

Return type:

SensitivityCase

nominalpy.nominalpy.sensitivity.configuration module

[ NOMINAL SYSTEMS ]

This code is developed by Nominal Systems to aid with communication to the public API. All code is under the the license provided along with the ‘nominalpy’ module. Copyright Nominal Systems, 2023.

class nominalpy.nominalpy.sensitivity.configuration.SensitivityConfiguration(credentials: Credentials = None)

Bases: ABC

The Configuration class allows for a custom simulation configuration to be created and iterated upon. This allows for an external runner to use the configuration and perform Monte-Carlo simulations with the specified configuration. For this to work correctly, all CHANGING components must be made public in the class (using the self keyword) and the configuration must be implemented in the ‘configure’ method.

add_credentials(credentials: Credentials) → None

Sets the credentials of the configuration based on the values passed in.

Parameters:

credentials (Credentials) – The application credentials for calling the API

abstract configure() → None

This method must be overridden by the base class and will ensure that the scenario is configured correctly. This is an abstract method and cannot be called manually on the base class.

find_object(name: str, type: type = None) → object

Attempts to find an object of a particular name (not case sensitive) as part of the self. parameters. Only objects that have been associated with the class object will be found. This can also ensure the types match if the optional type is passed.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the object to find within the configuration

  • type (type) – The type of object to search for if required

Returns:

The Python object if it is found of the correct type

Return type:

object

find_object_of_type(type: type) → object

Attempts to find an object of a particular type on the class-level of the object. Only objects that have been associated with the class object will be found.

Parameters:

type (type) – The type of object to search for in the class’s variables

Returns:

The Python object if it is found of the correct type

Return type:

object

get_credentials() → Credentials

Returns the current credentials of the configuration based on what has been passed in.

Returns:

The credentials associated with the current configuration

Return type:

Credentials

get_id() → str

Returns the ID of the simulation before the simulation is reset.

Returns:

The unique ID of the simulation

Return type:

str

get_simulation() → Simulation

Attempts to get the simulation from the class based on the objects within the class. This will ensure that a simulation object exists within the simulation.

Returns:

The simulation that exists within the object

Return type:

Simulation

reset() → bool

Attempts to reset the simulation and send through the configuration of the spacecraft and components again.

Returns:

Whether the simulation has been reset correctly

Return type:

bool

set_value(object: str, param: str, value: str) → bool

Adjusts a particular parameter on an object that can be searched for within the simulation. This will find an object, of a certain name (provided that the object is a self. object) and will attempt to set a parameter with a value. This will also return a boolean that is the success result of setting the parameter value.

Parameters:

  • object (str) – The name of the object that should be modified

  • param (str) – The name of the parameter within the object that should be modified

  • value (str) – The new value of the parameter that should be updated in the analysis

Returns:

A successful write process for setting the value

Return type:

bool

subscribe(object: str, message: str, interval: float = 10.0) → str

Attempts to subscribe to a message of a particular name on an object of a particular name that exists within the configuration. This will return the ID of the message.

Parameters:

  • object (str) – The name of the object that should be searched for in the analysis

  • message (str) – The name of the message that should be subscribed to in the object

  • interval (float) – The time interval that data should be captured at in simulation seconds

Returns:

The ID of the message that is subscribed to

Return type:

str

tick(step: float = 0.001, iterations: int = 1) → bool

Attempts to tick the simulation found within the configuration with some time-step and some iterations. This will be done by attempting to fetch the simulation object from the class object, if it does exist.

Parameters:

  • step (float) – The simulation tick step in simulation seconds

  • iterations (int) – The number of iterations with the desired step to run

Returns:

Whether the simulation is available and valid

Return type:

bool
